title: Font Awesome Quarto Extension
text:
This extension allows you to use font-awesome icons in your Quarto HTML and PDF documents. It provides an {{< fa >}} shortcode:
For example:
Note that the icon sets are currently not perfectly interchangeable across formats:

title: Font Awesome Quarto Extension
text:

Below is a comprehensive list of available Font Awesome 6.7.2 icons organized by category.

Complete Icon List
For a complete searchable list of all 2,000+ icons, visit the Font Awesome Icon Gallery.
Usage tips:

Most icons work without a group prefix: {{< fa icon-name >}}
Brand icons require the brands group: {{< fa brands icon-name >}}
Regular icons can use the regular group: {{< fa regular icon-name >}}
Solid icons (default) can optionally use solid group: {{< fa solid icon-name >}}

title: PL
text:
Paul Lafourcade


PhD, Research Engineer


LMCE, Bruyères-le-Châtel, France




I am a computational physicist specializing in the mechanical response of crystalline materials under extreme conditions, including high strain rates and shock loading. I am currently a researcher at the Laboratory for Matter in Extreme Conditions (LMCE), a CEA entity located in Bruyères-le-Châtel, France.
A significant part of my current work is devoted to the development of the open-source molecular dynamics (MD) code exaStamp, available on GitHub , along with its corresponding documentation .



Work in progress..

title: PL
text:
I am a computational physicist specializing in the mechanical response of crystalline materials under extreme conditions, including high strain rates and shock loading. I am currently a researcher at the Laboratory for Matter in Extreme Conditions (LMCE), a CEA entity located in Bruyères-le-Châtel, France.
A significant part of my current work is devoted to the development of the open-source molecular dynamics (MD) code exaStamp, available on GitHub , along with its corresponding documentation .
